com.flir.thermalsdk.image

Class Scale

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.flir.thermalsdk.image.Scale

  • public final class Scale
extends java.lang.Object
    Defines an image's linear scale object and basic scale's parameters. The scale defines the way the Palette is applied to the ThermalImage. Scale is an interval of the temperature, where colors from a selected Palette is applied. The available temperature's range is defined by the ThermalImage.

    Scale cannot be created directly, it should always be obtained from ThermalImage. To do so, the ThermalImage.getScale() method should be called.

    • Method Detail

      • enableAutoAdjust

        public void enableAutoAdjust(boolean enable)
        Sets auto adjust enabled or disabled. When auto adjust is enabled, the Scale will automatically update to match the image parameters.
        Parameters:
        enable - pass true to enable auto adjust, otherwise false.

      • isAutoAdjustEnabled

        public boolean isAutoAdjustEnabled()
        Gets auto adjust setting.
        Returns:
        true if auto adjust is enabled, otherwise false.

      • getRangeMin

        public double getRangeMin()
        Gets the minimum range, where colors defined by the Palette are applied to the ThermalImage.
        Returns:
        the minimum scale value.

      • getRangeMax

        public double getRangeMax()
        Gets the maximum range, where colors defined by the Palette are applied to the ThermalImage.
        Returns:
        the maximum scale value.

      • setRangeMin

        public void setRangeMin(double min)
        Sets the minimum range, where colors defined by the Palette are applied to the ThermalImage.

      • setRangeMax

        public void setRangeMax(double max)
        Sets the maximum range, where colors defined by the Palette are applied to the ThermalImage.

      • setRange

        public void setRange(double min,
                     double max)
        Sets the minimum and maximum scale values. It will define, how colors defined by the Palette are applied to the ThermalImage.
        Parameters:
        min - minimum scale value to be used.
        max - maximum scale value to be used.

      • getImage

        public JavaImageBuffer getImage()
        Gets a linear scale image as a JavaImageBuffer object. That image in the buffer is a visual representation of the Palette applied to the ThermalImage. It is used for drawing purposes.
        Returns:
        a linear scale image as a JavaImageBuffer object.
